quotes.quote: Guilty feelings about clothes are totally unnecessary. A lot of people earn their living by making clothes, so you should never feel bad.
Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind.
Guilt is just as powerful as shame, but its influence is positive, while shame's is destructive.
The guilty are always the most prone to establish complementary guilt, and the most unforgiving thereafter.
Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
The most guilty people are the most generous ones-this is the common law.
You may succeed in making another feel guilty about something by blaming him, but you won't succeed in changing whatever it is about you that is making you unhappy.
If you make someone feel guilty about their mistake, then you have not forgiven them. That guilt is itself punishment.
Every guilty person is his own hangman.
Don't feel guilty for a crime you have not committed, commit it and be guilt free.
True guilt is guilt at the obligation one owes to oneself to be oneself. False guilt is guilt felt at not being what other people feel one ought to be or assume that one is.
Pity for the guilty is treason to the innocent.
In law a man is guilty when he violates the rights of others. In ethics he is guilty if he only thinks of doing so.
Don't feel guilty about driving somewhere nice to run. If people can drive to a park to eat hot dogs, you can drive there to run.
A guilty conscience needs no accuser.
When one person makes an accusation, check to be sure he himself is not the guilty one. Sometimes it is those whose case is weak who make the most clamour.
When you are guilty, it is not your sins you hate but yourself.
He who is present at a wrongdoing and does not lift a hand to prevent it is as guilty as the wrongdoers.
Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
You were never created to live depressed, defeated, guilty, condemned, ashamed or unworthy. You were created to be victorious.
You're guilty until proven innocent. Perception is reality, that's the way that it is in this world.

Some people feel guilty about their anxieties and regard them as a defect of faith but they are afflictions, not sins. Like all afflictions, they are, if we can so take them, our share in the passion of Christ.
Guilt is not a response to anger; it is a response to one's own actions or lack of action.
Guilt is always hungry - don't let it consume you.
The guilty think all talk is of themselves.
No amount of guilt can change the past and no amount of worrying can change the future.
He who helps the guilty, shares the crime.
A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
Guilty people answer questions with a question.
Guilt is the source of sorrow, 'tis the fiend, Th' avenging fiend, that follows us behind, With whips and stings.
Today, let's set our minds and hearts on feeling more thankful for what we are than guilty for what we're not. Let's cut the threads of guilt with grace.
Whether life finds us guilty or not guilty, we ourselves know we are not innocent.
Guilt is the mind's way of suicide when you suppress your values.
